snippet: The tug of war between Japan and South Korea over a religious statue that both countries claim has revived memories of atrocities and resentments that go back centuries.
abstract: Tsushima Journal; prolonged battle between South Korea and Japan over ownership of Buddhist statue on Tsushima island has revived memories of atrocities and resentments between two cultures that go back hundreds of years; South Korean court has refused to repatriate statue after it was recovered from thieves, claiming that it might have been stolen from Korea centuries ago by Japanese pirates.

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue contributed reporting from Tokyo, and Su-hyun Lee from Seoul, South Korea.

lead_paragraph: The tug of war between Japan and South Korea over a religious statue that both countries claim has revived memories of atrocities and resentments that go back centuries.

headline.seo: Japan-Korea Dispute Revived by Statue’s Theft
headline.main: An Icon and a Symbol of Two Nations’ Anger
headline.print_headline: An Icon and a Symbol Of Two Nations’ Anger
